releases/0/tender/title: PAN2466 - Leicester Local Plan - Energy and Sustainable Design and Construction Study
releases/0/tender/description:
Leicester City Council requires consultancy services from suitably qualified and experienced Suppliers to provide technical support and justification for clear, deliverable and ambitious energy and sustainable design and construction policies within the forthcoming new Leicester Local Plan.

The Authority is preparing a new Local Plan for consultation which will replace the adopted Core Strategy (2014) and saved policies from the saved Local Plan (2006).  The new Local Plan will set out the vision and objectives for growth and sites for development in the City, up to 2036.  This study will also be used to inform: the production of technical notes; and/or Supplementary planning documents; and Energy and/or sustainability assessments requested from applicants as part of the local validation requirements; and Data collected as part of the annual monitoring reports associated with the new Local Plan.

Further information about the opportunity can be found in the tender documentation.

Submissions must be received via the EastMidsTenders portal: https://www.eastmidstenders.org/index.htm by 12:00 noon on 1 September 2020 at the very latest.

Late submissions and those received by any other means will not be accepted.  Any queries/questions regarding this opportunity must be received via the ProContract portal only, otherwise they will not be responded to.

releases/0/tender/title: Phase 8 Sheltered Housing Electrical Fire Safety Upgrade
releases/0/tender/description:
The London Borough of Hillingdon intends to upgrade Fire Detection to LD1 and replace existing electrical consumer units within Sheltered Housing Dwellings.

1.	1-32 Ascott Court, This is a sheltered housing scheme consisting of 39 Dwellings (32No. Internal One bed dwellings and 7No. External One bed dwellings)

2.	1-30 Barden Court, This is a sheltered housing scheme consisting of 30 Dwellings (30 No.Internal One bed dwellings)

3.	24-39 Roberts Close, This is a sheltered housing scheme consisting of 64 Dwellings (16No. Internal One bed dwellings and 48 No. External One bed dwellings)

4.	1-32 Barr Lodge, This is a sheltered housing scheme consisting of 47 Dwellings (32 No.Internal One bed dwellings & 15No External OPne Bed Dwellings)

5.	1-29 Sibley Court, This is a sheltered housing scheme consisting of 29 Dwellings (29 No.Internal One bed dwellings)

6.	1-30 Mandela Court, This is a sheltered Housing scheme consisting of 41 Dwellings (30 No. Internal One bed dwellings and 11No External One Bed Dwellings)

The works include, but not limited to the Design, supply, installation, commissioning and hand-over of complete and fully functional LD1 Fully Interlinked Fire Detection System within 63 external dwellings & replace existing consumer unit within 250 No one bed Dwellings across 6 No Sheltered Housing Schemes.

The Installer is expected to provide his rates for the entire Schedule of Works (SOW) listed even if the work is to be performed by a sub-Installer or specialist Contractor. It is the Tenderer's responsibility to obtain the required rates from specialist sub-Contractors to complete the pricing schedule. 

No access to dwellings available during tender period

Estimated duration 8 weeks

releases/0/title: Universal Youth and Play Services - Supplier Engagement Event
releases/0/description:
The City of London Corporation are redesigning the delivery of services to support young people living in the City aged between 8-19 years of age (and up to 25 for young people Leaving Care and young people with disabilities).
The City would like to meet experienced and qualified youth practitioners to present and discuss our plans for future youth services for the City. The key areas of service delivery are likely to cover: Universal Youth and Play Services.
If you are interested in helping the City of London shape their vision for youth services, ahead of an intended competitive tender process in September 2020, please reserve a place at our engagement event: Venue: Virtual Platform via Microsoft Teams. Date: Friday 21 August 2020. Time: 11.00 and 14.00.
To reserve your place please email: chris.mulhall@cityoflondon.gov.uk and state your time preference for either 11.00 or 14.00 (or mark as no preference).
Further details concerning the session will be provided upon registration.

releases/0/tender/title: Support For Refugee Women During COVID-19 Pandemic
releases/0/tender/description:
The Home Office is seeking to award grant funding to one or more non-statutory sector organisations in the United Kingdom (England, Northern Ireland, Scotland and Wales) working nationally to provide support to refugee women. The total available grant funding for the 2020/21 financial year will be £600,000.

Bidders for the funding must be able to demonstrate how they will spend their entire potential award by the end of the 2020/21 financial year. To ensure that there is as full as a geographic spread as possible we would welcome bids from partnerships or consortia.

The purpose of the funding is to provide support to a vitally important sector doing excellent work with refugee women. The Home Office is providing the grant funding to deliver support to refugee women, across the UK, to meet needs associated with the Covid-19 restrictions and the Covid-19 recovery. We expect the focus of support to be largely on addressing digital poverty but will consider suggestions for other support where bidders are able to demonstrate that these are high priority. 

Grants will be awarded to non-statutory sector organisations working nationally to provide services that help and support refugee women during the Covid-19 pandemic. 

While there is no cap on the amount of funding an organisation can bid for, up to the maximum of the funding of £600,000, we may award to one or more organisations. Therefore, all bids will need to be scalable: to ensure diversity of funding, please be aware that we may have to scale back top scoring bids.

releases/0/tender/title: Dental Clinical Holding Training
releases/0/tender/description:
Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust are looking to appoint a training provider to deliver our clinical holding training for dental services in Kent and London.  Initial training will be required followed by annual updates to be provided in Year 2 and Year 3.
We require 3 separate training courses that will deliver the following content:-
Non- Restrictive healthcare programme breakaway training - Approximately 32 staff members (maximum 10-12 people per training day)
Clinical holding non-restrictive interruption training - Approximately 20 staff members (maximum 10-12 people per training day)
Clinical holding restrictive interruption training - Approximately 32 staff members (maximum 10-12 people per training day)
Each of the three training programmes listed above should not require more than 1 full day's classroom training per cohort to meet outcomes, when supported with distance learning solutions.
The training provider must be BILD accredited and must deliver training in accordance with British Society for Disability and Oral Health, Unblock barriers to care, guidelines for "clinical holding" skills for dental services.
Any suppliers must be able to deliver training at locations in East Kent and London, provide their own training equipment and provide any supporting e-learning modules in SCORM files to be hosted on the Trust's Learning Management System (SCORM files)
Any suppliers interested in this opportunity will need to register their expression of interest (EOI) via the Due North (Proactis) Portal which can be found using the following link https://procontract.due-north.com/Login/   with opportunity number   DN466738 if you have an existing account or you will need to register for an account.  The ITQ documentation will be provided to all bidders expressing an interest on the 5th March 2020.
(Please note that Cohort = maximum 10-12 people depending on actual breakdown of numbers)
releases/0/buyer/name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust
releases/0/awards/0/suppliers/0/address/: Redlands Barn. Redlands Lane, Robertsbridge, East Sussex, TN32 5NA

releases/0/tender/title: WO0298 Calne Leisure Centre Refurbishment
releases/0/tender/description:
In its current form Calne Leisure Centre dates back to the 1980s and is in urgent need of modernisation and refurbishment. Once completed the facility will provide the community in Calne with the following:
• A completely redesigned village style wet changing area
• A modernised, refurbished, and extended Fitness Suite that will double the current floorspace
• A refurbished reception area, dance studio and dry changing area
• Increased efficiency ratings through the use of modernised internal building fabrics
• A reduced maintenance requirement
The procurement will take the form of an Open RfQ tender process - tenderers are required to access the opportunity via the ProContract portal (link below) and Express an Interest, whereupon the tender documents will be made automatically available to them. All communication regarding the procurement will be made via the portal.

releases/0/tender/description:
This procurement is designed to find suitable contractors to provide Home to School or College transport for students based in Rutland on a number of routes as defined in the Schedules. The routes are assigned to a number of Lots in the tender as follows:

Lot 1: Local Bus Services

Bidders may bid for as many or as few routes as they wish and need not bid for all routes within a Lot.
The details of new contract start dates are shown against each route on offer in the Schedule of Routes (Part Two D). The earliest start date is 31st August 2020.

releases/0/tender/title: Whitley Bay Crematorium New Cremator Installation Project Reference 19-068
releases/0/tender/description:
Supply and installation of new cremator. The works are to be completed within the cremator room and on the roof from the 22nd June 2020 to the 27th November 2020, and shall include the isolation, disconnection and removal of existing cremator equipment and the supply, installation, testing and commissioning of all new cremator and mercury abatement equipment. The site is Whitley Bay Crematorium and Cemetery, The Links, Whitley Bay NE26 4NH. The Contractor must visit the site prior to submitting their price, this is a mandatory requirement, and this must be arranged in advance via contacting the named NTC person in the Works Information document. Tenderers must not attend or contact the site without a prior appointment. 
The site will be occupied in various locations during the works. This may be in the form of burial services within the chapel and the cemetery grounds. The book of remembrance will be within the existing buildings and this facility will be accessed by the public. A private tenant resides within the lodge at the main entrance to the site. The private tenant has fixed parking to the right of the main gates and this must remain available to them at all times - no construction or delivery vehicles shall be parked there or cause a restriction.

The main entrance to the Whitley Bay Cemetery is via the main gated entrance off the A193 The Links, which is flanked by stone pillars. This shall be noted on the site visit as the opening size will dictate the size of site and delivery vehicles that can access the site
